title: Danza Macabra - Happy Halloween!
content:
[![Danza Macabra](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414182111im_/http:/farm6.staticflickr.com/5515/10154860914_c55c1c3f48_z.jpg)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414182111/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/turetsky-lukyan/10154860914/ "Danza Macabra by Lukyan Turetsky, on Flickr")  
That's a special horrific font with an intricate pattern of bones. All letters are put together of nonrecurring elements drawn individually by hand. The classical forms as we see it sound afresh with the bones attire.  
Design by Ivan Turetskyy, Lukyan Turetskyy

[![Danza Macabra](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414182111im_/http:/farm8.staticflickr.com/7295/10155038376_bdcd262b90_z.jpg)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414182111/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/turetsky-lukyan/10155038376/ "Danza Macabra by Lukyan Turetsky, on Flickr")

[![Danza Macabra](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414182111im_/http:/farm6.staticflickr.com/5465/10155037956_6902f4de25_z.jpg)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414182111/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/turetsky-lukyan/10155037956/ "Danza Macabra by Lukyan Turetsky, on Flickr")

[On MyFonts!](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414182111/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/2d-typo/danza-macabra/)
author: Lukas_

comments.content: Sounds like you have a bone to pick re that, @Nick.
Not really, just an observation that it’s (incidentally) without ligatures.

Yes, cheerful character :))) @Special-K  
I love this:
